description:
POSITION TITLE: Director of Development: Corporate and Retail Partnerships
STATUS: Full Time
FLSA STATUS Exempt (salaried)
REPORTS TO: Chief Development Officer
PROGRAM: Development
LOCATION: Ann Moody Place

Position summary below is not inclusive of additional responsibilities.

Position Summary:
This high-energy, external role directs The Family Place’s corporate strategy, including the largest signature fundraiser: Partners Card. This 30+ year-old shopping program raises more than $1.2M+ annually through retail partnerships, sponsorships, and individual card sales. This position also focuses on year-round corporate partnerships that support The Family Place’s revenue, volunteer, and in-kind needs. The ideal candidate has worked in corporate engagement or retail partnerships, and has experience with public relations, marketing, and special events. If you have a passion for creating partnerships, as well as interest in leveraging technology to achieve efficiency and digital transformation, please apply!

This position reports to the CDO and will work closely with organizational leadership including the Executive Team, Board and external agency partners to expand the brand of The Family Place with corporate and retail partners.

Key Responsibilities:
• Grow and expand the Partners Card program including the following elements:
• Build and maintain retail partner relations and solicitations
• Identify sponsors, solicitation and stewardship
• Cultivate relationships with Community Sellers identification, solicitation and stewardship
• Manage Partners Card events from concept to completion
• Lead and manage the development of collateral material, print production, digital tool kit
• Coordinate advertising deadlines
• Develop and implement communications, social media, and marketing plans to support Partners Card in partnership with public relations agency, internal special events leader, and development team.
• Other duties related to Partners Card:
• Manage correspondence and applications with 750+ participating retailers.
• Lead Partners Card planning meetings and provide meeting minutes, maintain Partners Card records, notebooks, and files for special projects.
• Respond to general requests for Partners Card information.
• Oversee website and database support for Partners Card

Other Duties:
• Develop and maintain corporate partnerships/relationships on behalf of The Family Place.
• Collaborate with Development Team on Corporate Events strategy, ensuring all relationships are focused on
• Perform other job-related duties at the request of Development Team leaders and CEO.

Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field. Five plus years of retail/marketing/public relations/development/special events experience.

Licenses and Certifications: Valid Texas Driver’s License

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Excellent level of project management, planning, budgeting, and financial tracking.
• Knowledge and skill in managing donor databases.
• Knowledge and skill of advanced MS Office Suite, Excel, Desktop Publishing and proficient in Acrobat Adobe.
• Knowledge of branding strategies and social media development and execution.
• Skilled in analytical and technical writing techniques and proficient in research.
• Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management, coworkers, stakeholders, donors, board members, etc. in a professional manner.
• Ability to multitask, coordinate, and deliver results within a specific timeframe.
• Ability to perform under pressure and meet demanding deadlines while maintaining flexibility.
• Ability to prioritize and self-motivate to accomplish and surpass goals.
• Ability to work some evenings and weekends, as needed.
• Possess excellent organizational, written, interpersonal, and communication skills.

Mental and Physical Abilities: Ability to drive vehicle to event venues, retailers, donors, sponsors, and other meetings.

Working Conditions: Duties are usually performed seated with occasional periods of standing or walking. Limited physical effort is required associated with lifting and carrying objects (less than 25 pounds). Work may be performed in but is not limited to an office environment.

Essential Functions: This job description should not be interpreted as all inclusive. It is intended to identify the essential functions and requirements of this position. The incumbents may be requested to perform job-related responsibilities and tasks other than those stated in this job description.

Job Type: Full-time
